---
title: "Content Runtime"
execute:
  eval: false
---

## Description

Get the language runtimes for a content item.

## Recipe

::: {.panel-tabset group="language"}

## Python

```{.python}
from posit import connect

client = connect.Client()

item = client.content.find_one(prefix="Data Science Quarterly Report")

print(item.py_version)
print(item.quarto_version)
print(item.r_version)
```

### Example output

```console
>>> 3.7.2
>>> 0.9.37
>>> 4.1.1
```

## R

```{r}
library(connectapi)
client <- connect()

#### User-defined inputs ####
# 1. Specify the GUID for the content item you wish to examine.
guid <- "154bd2af-e8fa-4aa4-aab8-dcef701f4af9"
###########################

library(connectapi)
client <- connect()
item <- get_content(client, guid = guid)
item$r_version
item$quarto_version
item$py_version
```

Your call to `get_content` can specify an item by its `guid`, or with its `name` and `owner_guid`. You can find the content GUID in the Info panel of the content sidebar in the Connect Dashboard.

### Example output

```console
[1] "3.7.2"
[1] "0.9.37"
[1] "4.1.1"
```

:::
